root_causes: The validation does not handle cases where qCountry is system-missing. Comparisons like qCountry<>12 evaluate as false for system-missing, so records with missing qCountry and non-missing/invalid FR2 will not be flagged.
instructions: Include an explicit check for missing qCountry in the presence/range selection so records with a missing entry-condition variable are flagged. Example corrected selector: sel if miss(qCountry) or (qCountry=12 and (miss(FR2) or ~range(FR2,1,2))) or (qCountry<>12 and ~miss(FR2)).
Keep the HARD SCREEN selection as-is (sel if qCountry=12 and FR2=2), but ensure it runs separately after adding the missing-qCountry handling to the validation above.

root_causes: Allowed-value check is incorrect: the code uses range(FR2,1,1) which only permits answer code 1. Answer code 2 (valid 'Non') will be treated as invalid.

No handling for special codes (97, 98, 99) — the script will flag those as invalid/missing even if they should be treated as acceptable special codes or system-missing, depending on project conventions.
instructions: Fix the allowed-value range to include both valid answers 1 and 2. Replace ~range(FR2,1,1) with ~range(FR2,1,2). For example: sel if (flt=1 and (miss(FR2) or ~range(FR2,1,2))) or (flt=0 and ~miss(FR2)).

If special codes 97/98/99 should be treated as acceptable (not flagged as invalid), adjust the condition to exclude them from invalid checks. Example: sel if (flt=1 and (miss(FR2) or (~range(FR2,1,2) and not FR2 in (97,98,99)))) or (flt=0 and ~miss(FR2)).
If special codes should be treated as missing for this validation, explicitly include them in the miss() test: use (miss(FR2) or FR2 in (97,98,99) or ~range(FR2,1,2)) as appropriate.

root_causes: Answer code 3 (the hard-screen response) is treated as invalid: the script uses range(IT1,1,2) which excludes code 3.
No handling or consideration of special codes (97, 98, 99) — if these exist they are not allowed as valid values and will be flagged as invalid.
instructions: Allow answer code 3 as a valid response when qCountry = 16. Replace the validity check ~range(IT1,1,2) with ~range(IT1,1,3) or use ~any(IT1,1,2,3) so that 1, 2 and 3 are treated as valid.

If survey special codes (97, 98, 99) should be accepted or handled specially, include them in the valid-value check (for example any(IT1,1,2,3,97,98,99)) or add explicit logic to treat them according to the project's rules.

Ensure that IT1=3 remains a valid (hard-screen) response and is not flagged by the selection; hard-screening behavior should be handled elsewhere but must not be treated as an invalid answer in this validation step.

root_causes: The allowed answer range used in the validation is range(ES1,1,2) which excludes answer code 3 (the hard-screen value) — ES1=3 is being treated as invalid rather than a valid hard-screen response.
No explicit handling/informational listing for ES1=3 as a hard-screen (expected logic indicates ES1 any '3' is a hard-screen).
instructions: Change the allowed range to include code 3 so valid responses are 1-3. For example, modify the selection to: sel if (flt=1 and (miss(ES1) or ~range(ES1,1,3))) or (flt=0 and ~miss(ES1)).

If you want to both accept ES1=3 as a valid response but also separately report hard-screen cases, add an additional temporary check/list after or instead of the main check to list records where flt=1 and ES1=3 (e.g. temporary. sel if flt=1 and ES1=3. list respid qCountry ES1.).

If special codes (97,98,99) are used in this dataset, decide whether they should be treated as valid or invalid and include them explicitly in the allowed values (e.g. ~range(ES1,1,3) and not any(ES1,97,98,99) or include them in range/any as appropriate).

root_causes: Allowed answer range is incorrect: code 3 is valid per expected logic but the script only accepts 1-2 (uses range(UK1,1,2)). This causes UK1=3 (the hard-screen response) to be flagged as invalid.
Hard-screen condition (UK1 == 3) is not handled as a valid response; the script effectively treats it as an error instead of allowing it (and/or marking it for hard-screen workflow).
No handling/consideration included for any special codes (e.g. 97/98/99) — if such codes are used in this survey they are neither allowed nor explicitly treated as system-missing.
instructions: Allow answer code 3 as a valid response for UK1. Replace ~range(UK1,1,2) with ~range(UK1,1,3) or use an explicit membership test such as ~any(UK1,1,2,3) so that UK1=3 is not flagged as invalid.

Ensure the hard-screen semantics are respected: treat UK1=3 as a valid survey outcome (and, if required by workflow, add any separate reporting/selection logic to flag respondents for hard-screening) rather than flagging it as a validation error.

If the questionnaire uses special codes (97/98/99) and they should be accepted or treated as non-error values, include them in the allowed-values check (e.g. any(UK1,1,2,3,97,98,99)) or explicitly treat them as system-missing if that is the intended behavior.

root_causes: Incorrect allowed range: the script uses range(US1,1,2) which excludes valid answer code 3 ('I decline to participate').
No handling/inclusion of special codes (97/98/99) if those are used in this project (expected answers list does not show them, but script provides no allowance for them).
instructions: Change the validity check upper bound to include code 3. Replace ~range(US1,1,2) with ~range(US1,1,3) so answers 1, 2 and 3 are accepted for US respondents.

If your survey uses special codes (e.g. 97/98/99), include them explicitly in the allowed set. For example replace ~range(US1,1,3) with ~(any(US1,1,2,3,97,98,99)) or use ~range(...) combined with any() to permit those codes.

root_causes: Missing entry condition gating: expected this hidden/test quota to run only in test mode (isTest()), but the script does not restrict execution to isTest()
instructions: Restrict the computation and validation to test mode by adding the isTest() condition. For example, only execute the mapping/check when isTest() is true (e.g. wrap the sel if with an additional isTest() clause or include isTest() in the logical expression).

Alternatively, precede the checks with a conditional such as: temporary. sel if isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group1) or ~range(HidS1Group1,1,3) or (hidS1g1_chk <> HidS1Group1)). so that the hidden quota validation only runs in test mode.

root_causes: Missing entry condition gating: expected this hidden/test quota to run only in test mode (isTest()), but the script does not restrict execution to isTest()
instructions: Restrict the computation and validation to test mode by adding the isTest() condition. For example, only execute the mapping/check when isTest() is true (e.g. wrap the sel if with an additional isTest() clause or include isTest() in the logical expression).

Alternatively, precede the checks with a conditional such as: temporary. sel if isTest() and (miss(HidS1Group2) or ~range(HidS1Group2,1,2) or (hidS1g2_chk <> HidS1Group2)). so that the hidden quota validation only runs in test mode.

root_causes: Validation allows only answer code 1 (range(S0c,1,1)), but expected valid answers are codes 1 and 2.
Respondents who legitimately answered code 2 will be (incorrectly) flagged/selected as invalid.
instructions: Change the selection condition to accept both valid codes 1 and 2. For example: sel if miss(S0c) or ~range(S0c,1,2).
Alternatively use any() to be explicit: sel if miss(S0c) or ~any(S0c,1,2).
If your questionnaire uses special codes (e.g. 97/98/99) and they should be treated as valid or excluded, incorporate them explicitly into the range/any check.

root_causes: Validation only allows answer code 1 (uses range(S0c,1,1)), thereby excluding the valid code 2.
Does not validate the full set of expected answer codes {1,2}.
instructions: Change the selection/validation to allow both valid codes 1 and 2. For example: sel if miss(S0c) or ~range(S0c,1,2).
Alternatively use any(): sel if miss(S0c) or ~any(S0c,1,2).

root_causes: Validation only allows answer code 1 (uses range(FR1,1,1)), thereby excluding the valid code 2.
Does not validate the full set of expected answer codes {1,2}.
instructions: Change the selection/validation to allow both valid codes 1 and 2. For example: sel if miss(FR1) or ~range(FR1,1,2).
Alternatively use any(): sel if miss(FR1) or ~any(FR1,1,2).

root_causes: Validation only allows answer code 1 (uses range(FR2,1,1)), thereby excluding the valid code 2.
Does not validate the full set of expected answer codes {1,2}.
instructions: Change the selection/validation to allow both valid codes 1 and 2. For example: sel if miss(FR2) or ~range(FR2,1,2).
Alternatively use any(): sel if miss(FR2) or ~any(FR2,1,2).

root_causes: Validation allows only codes 1 and 2 (uses ~any(IT1,1,2)), thereby excluding the valid code 3.
Does not validate the full set of expected answer codes {1,2,3}.
instructions: Change the selection/validation to include code 3. For example: sel if miss(IT1) or ~any(IT1,1,2,3).
Or use a range if codes are contiguous: sel if miss(IT1) or ~range(IT1,1,3).
